name: plotty
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you describe a book or a film as plotty, you mean that it has a very detailed story in which a lot of different things happen: At this point the story gets plotty, and a whole new set of problems emerges. I love to watch a good, plotty spy thriller.
More examplesFewer examplesThis film is more plotty than character-driven. There is not enough action in the original novel to make a very plotty film.The script is very plotty and keeps driving the action forwards.
